posts.name: Jorge Lopez
posts.cooked: Hello, these days we have been having a problem with our robot, currently the roborio only has the swerve code (with Falcon motors) but when using the robot after a few seconds everything restarts, making the robot disable and losing communication. We have already tried to see versions and everything is fine, we have already pulled the switch, and the robot does not turn off, we do not know what it could be.

Hello,

Could this be an exception in the robot code? Robots display the “restart” behavior you speak of when the roboRIO repeatedly tries to run code, runs into an exception that shuts it down, and boots itself back up again.

posts.name: Jorge Lopez
posts.cooked: It could be, however, what I don’t understand is what this exception is, since this code was generated through the template that phoenix tuner X offers, so this should not be happening.
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.name: Angel
posts.cooked:
This could be a power issue. Check you wires and make sure they’re connected properly and not loose.

It could also be a voltage issue. Make sure the battery you are using is not low. Also watch the voltage when the robot is driving. If it drops below 7v you risk browning out

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Could you look at the DS logs for the instance where it’s restarting? Or better yet, share the files (both .dslog and .dsevents) here?

Hello, I am part of the team, I could not send the log file here, but I send the error that I get when it disconnects: “Warning 44000 Driver Station not keeping up with protocol rates Driver Station ”.

posts.name: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons
posts.cooked:
Auton mode achieved!

Seriousness aside…I hope it can be figured out!
posts.display_username: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons

posts.name: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons
posts.cooked: Which Roborio are you using?  It MAY help diagnose better.  IF it is the 2…it MAY be a card issue.
posts.display_username: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: That’s just a warning not an error, and is likely just a symptom of the problem rather than the problem itself.  That message will appear anytime the rio disconnects from the DS for any reason.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked:
When it restarts, what do the LEDs on the roboRIO do?

If the STATUS LED comes on orange for a few seconds (and COMM goes out), your roboRIO is rebooting, which is probably due to a power issue (such as a loose connector).

If the COMM LED turns red (and then goes back to green), your robot code is crashing and restarting.
We are using a Roborio 1, can’t tell you the date it was fabricated though (if that even helped).

reply_to_user.name: Ric Ferrell Mentor for 5503 Tiger Trons

posts.cooked: We have the orange status LED problem, but even after checking the wiring, we couldn’t figure out why the problem persists. We have the hypothesis that the roboRio is causing the problem and we cleared everything in it that may have caused memory issues.

Checking in on the issue, we will try all the roboRios 1.0 we have and see if we still get the same problem—fortunately, roboRio 2.0 is back in stock and we will consider heavily buying a bundh of those.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: Sorry I am under the impression they are limited too 1 per team. Why also invest too heavily in a platform that has a replacement coming in the next couple of years?

posts.name: Asher Olgeirson
posts.cooked: Rios are not limited per team. We have 3 of each.

posts.name: Alex
posts.cooked: No i meant to say that i think they are limited to how many you can buy per team. This is why they make you input your team number in the purchase screen if i remember correctly. ( This may not be true anymore though ).

posts.name: Jorge Lopez
posts.cooked: We have already found the problem, first of all thank you very much for all your support, it turns out that it was a false contact that was generated in the switch when the robot was moving. If you have the same problem, I invite you to take into account, both the switch and the battery itself.

posts.name: alst
posts.cooked: That is not at all the case. It is true that they have frequently been out of stock in recent years, and it’s possible that AndyMark was limiting sales to 1 per team per restock , but there has never been a limit to how many roboRIOs a team is allowed to own, or purchase over all time.

posts.name: philso
posts.cooked:
Jorge_L:

a short circuit that was generated in the switch

Do you mean that the main circuit breaker was going open at times? Were all the terminals with screws/studs and nuts (battery, main breaker, old black PDP ) tight enough that the lugs cannot be rotated?

posts.name: Jorge Lopez
posts.cooked: Sorry, it was not a short circuit, but rather a false contact, the switch terminal somehow got damaged (probably due to movement and use).

accepted_answer.excerpt: We have already found the problem, first of all thank you very much for all your support, it turns out that it was a false contact that was generated in the switch when the robot was moving. If you have the same problem, I invite you to take into account, both the switch and the battery itself.
